questions.question: The following are true concerning secondary hyperparathyroidism

options.option: Serum Calcium is usually raised
It may complicate abdominal tuberculosis
Parathyroid hormone is high
Serum phosphate is low or normal
Alkaline phosphatase is usually low

questions.question: The following are clinical presentations of prolactinomas in a female

options.option: Majority have galactorrhoea
Menorrhagea
Infertility
Visual field defect
Reduced libido

questions.question: The following is/are true concerning a 30 year old asymptomatic man whose fasting plasma glucose was 128mg/dl:

options.option: He is diabetic.
Diabetes is unlikely
If he is diabetic, type 2 is unlikely
He should commence anti-diabetic agents  immediately
If serum C-peptide is nil, type 2 diabetes is likely

questions.question: The following may help to distinguish hyperthyroidism from hypothyroidism in a 32 yr old lady

options.option: Weight gain
Anterior neck swelling
Fatigue
Intellectual impairment
Amenorrhoea

questions.question: Possible cause(s) of grossly elevated ACTH include

options.option: Addison’s disease
Nelson’s syndrome
Exogeous use of steroid cream
Lung cancer
Carcinoid tumours

questions.question: Which of the  following disorders does not  display koebner’s phenomenon

options.option: Psoriasis
Lichen  planus
Vitiligo
Plane warts
Pityriasis rosea

questions.question: Which of the following statements about psoriasis is not true?

options.option: It  is minimally pruritic
Scalp psoriasis leads to significant alopecia
Splinter haemorrhage may appear when the nail is involved
Joint involvement may mimic  rheumatoid arthritis
HLA CW6 has been associated with psoriasis

questions.question: Which of the following drugs leads to alopecia

options.option: Prednisolone
Paracetamol
Heparin
Interferon
Lugol’s iodine

questions.question: Which of the following does not cause pruritus

options.option: Polycythemia rubra vera
Hyperthyroidism
Hypothyroidism
Hodgkins lymphoma
Leprosy

questions.question: The following statements about the patch test are true except

options.option: It is a type IV hypersensitivity test
The allergens are usually applied on the back
The patient must be free of an eczematous rash
The risk of anaphylaxis is high
The test is usually read after 48 hours

questions.question: The following are true concerning tremors

options.option: Coarse unilateral tremor in Parkinson’s disease
Titubation in cerebellar disease
Pill-rolling action tremor in Parkinson’s disease
Bilateral fine tremors in Benign essential tremor
Alcohol typically worsens benign essential tremors

questions.question: The following descriptions are true

options.option: Right-sided Jacksonian march(sec. generalized tonic-clonic) indicates a left hemispheric lesion
Complex partial seizure is characterised by abrupt loss of consciousness
Complex partial seizure is characterised by automatisms, amnesia and impairment of consciousness
Versive turning of the head to the right side suggests a right hemispheric lesion
Seizures are due to hypersynchronus abnormal discharges of the lower motor neurone

questions.question: Causes of secondary headache include

options.option: Migraine with aura
Pseudotumor cerebri
Severe tension type headache
Stroke
Mastoiditis

questions.question: Risk factors for stroke include

options.option: Hyperhomocysteinemia T(thromboembolic disorder)
Sickle cell disease
Hypotension
Moderate alcohol consumption
Metabolic syndrome

questions.question: In the acute management of stroke

options.option: Blood pressure should be reduced rapidly
5% Dextrose water is the iv fluid of choice
Neuroimaging should be delayed until the second day
Heparin is suitable for preventing deep venous thrombosis in all cases of stroke
Intraventricular hemorrhage is not associated with meningeal signs

questions.question: The following conditions may complicate Typhoid Fever

options.option: Orchitis
Pneumonia
Osteomyelitis
Arthritis
Hepatitis

questions.question: Concerning shigellosis

options.option: The incubation period is about 7 days
‘Rice-water’ stool is characteristic
Tenesmus is not a feature
Anaemia may be present
May be complicated by colonic toxic dilatation

questions.question: The following can cause Acute Pancreatitis

options.option: Gallstones
Alcohol
Hypercalcaemia
Scorpion sting
Hydrochlorothiazide

questions.question: The following are causes of acute diarrhoea

options.option: Vibrio Cholerae
Aluminium-containing antacids
Chronic Pancreatitis
Zollinger – Ellison Syndrome
Faecal impaction

questions.question: The following agents can be used to treat peptic ulcer disease

options.option: Pantoprazole
Pirenzepine
Sucralfate
Colloidal Bismuth
Aluminium Hydroxide

questions.question: The following statements are false about asthma

options.option: Aetiology is mutifactorial
It is an acute inflammatory airway disease
Typical symptoms are wheeze, dyspnoea, cough and chest tightness
It may be associated with nasal polyp
Occupational asthma may be caused by colophony

questions.question: Differential of recurrent wheezing include:

options.option: Chronic rhino-sinusitis
Gastroeosophageal reflux
Tuberculosis
Foreign body aspiration
Primary ciliary dyskinesia

questions.question: In chronic pulmonary airway disease

options.option: Disease is characterized by variable airflow obstruction
All the cases are smoking related
The inflammatory cells secrete TNF, IL8 and leukotrien B4 (LTB4)
Minimal bronchodilator reversibility is greater than 20%.
Periacinar  emphysema occur with dilated air spaces found in association with respiratory bronchioles

questions.question: Tuberculosis

options.option: Spread is by airborne transmission of droplet nuclei.
Cases with cavities are more likely to be sputum smear negative
Primary infection usually shows a lesion in the right lower lung zone.
HIV infection is an insignificant risk factor.
Miliary TB refers to widespread micro cavities in both lung fields.

questions.question: Tuberculosis

options.option: Sputum culture using bactec radiometric system will take a minimum of 4 weeks
Mantoux reading of 14mm×12mm is diagnostic
Moxifloxacin is a fluroquinolone useful in treatment of multidrug resistant TB
d capreomycin, cycloserine and gentamycin  are all  2nd line antiTB drugs
Pyrazinamide is associated with orange to pink colouration of urine, sweats and tears

questions.question: In tuberculosis

options.option: Tuberculous pleural effusion usually results from direct invasion of pleura by the acid-fast bacillus.
In patients with co morbid HIV/Tb infection, response to therapy is usually poor
Intestinal bypass surgery is  associated with the development of tuberculosis
Elevation of uric acid levels with arthralgia occurs with use of rifampicin
Exposure to Silica has been shown to potentiates the growth of Mycobacterial tuberculosis

questions.question: Concerning Interstitial lung diseases:

options.option: Digital clubbing occurs in about 50%(10-25) of cases in Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis
In Sarcoidosis, peak age occurrence is in the 6th decade of life
In hypersensitivity pneumonitis (extrinsic allergic alveolitis), sputum eosinophilia is often a common finding
Predominantly lymphocytic bronchoalveolar lavage is typically seen in Sarcoidosis
Lung airways are not known to be affected in Interstitial lung diseases

questions.question: HIV and lung:

options.option: Early HIV/TB infection present with hilar adenopathy
In advanced HIV/TB co-infection cavitations are usually present on CXR
Lymphocytic interstitial pneumonitis is common in adult HIV
Pulmonary Kaposi sarcoma is diagnosed on bronchoscopy biopsy of the lesion
Pneumocystic jiroveci often present with nodular opacities in CXR

questions.question: Typical features of early onset bronchial asthma include

options.option: Paroxysmal expiratory wheeze and dyspnoea
Individuals are usually atopic
Association with nasal polyps
Aspergillus fumigatus is usually present in the sputum
A single allergen can often be identified

questions.question: In alpha1-antitrypsin deficiency:

options.option: Chest x-ray shows basal hyperlucency
Inheritance is autosomal dominant
A single base change is the underlying defect
Emphysema is of a panacinar type
Is associated with bronchiectasis

questions.question: Concerning Diabetes Mellitus

options.option: Type 1 diabetes occurs as a result of a combination of insulin resistance and impaired insulin secretion
Obesity is a major modifiable risk factor for type 2 diabetes mellitus
Antibodies to islet cell antigens are present in up to 85-90% of persons with type 1A diabetes mellitus at the time of initial diagnosis
Insulin is a potent inhibitor of glycogenolysis, lipolysis & gluconeogenesis
Insulin resistance results in increased glucose uptake by target tissues & decreased hepatic gluconeogenesis

questions.question: Concerning the following:

options.option: The responsibility for the treatment of persons with diabetes mellitus lies solely with the Physician
An optimal target for treatment in persons with diabetes mellitus is a glycosylated hemoglobin level (HbA1c) level of less than 7%
The diet for a person with diabetes should be centered around a eating plan which excludes carbohydrates
Obese persons with type 2 diabetes are the only persons who require regular physical activity to aid glycemic control.
Metformin therapy should be the first choice, if an oral glucose lowering agent becomes necessary in the treatment of an obese person with type 2 diabetes

questions.question: Concerning the following:

options.option: Soluble insulin has a more rapid onset of action and gives better post prandial glucose control than insulin aspart or insulin Lispro
Lipohypertrophy is a well recognized complication of insulin therapy
Insulin therapy is rarely required in the management of persons with type 2 diabetes mellitus
Lifestyle interventions have been proven to be extremely useful in the prevention oftype 2 diabetes
Exenatide is a potent insulin releasing drug, licensed for use in persons with type 1diabetes mellitus

questions.question: Concerning the following:

options.option: Ketoacidosis is a common presenting feature of type 2 diabetes mellitus
An overnight fasting plasma glucose concentration of 110 mg/dl (6.1 mmol/l) on two separate occasions is diagnostic of diabetes mellitus
Type 2 diabetes mellitus does not occur in persons below the age of 40 years
Type 2 diabetes may be asymptomatic and consequently be undiagnosed for years
Low birth weight infants are at an increased risk for developing type 2 diabetes

questions.question: Concerning the following:

options.option: The presence of leucocytosis in a patient with DKA confirms the presence of  infectionT
Diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) does not occur in persons with Type 2 diabetes
The initial fluid of choice in the rehydration of patients with DKA is isotonic saline (0.9% NaCl)
NPH insulin is a good choice for the management of patients presenting with acute metabolic complications of diabetes mellitus
Heavy alcohol ingestion increases the risk of developing severe hypoglycemia in a person with diabetes mellitus

questions.question: Concerning Polycystic Kidney disease

options.option: Inheritance is genetically determined only in the infantile type.
Females are particularly more affected than males in the adult type.
Due to the presence of numerous cysts, renal function usually deteriorates fast.
Hypertension is an uncommon feature.
Ultrasound screening of family members is an important part of the management.

questions.question: The following conditions lead to obstructive uropathy by causing retroperitoneal fibrosis:

options.option: Prolonged tetracycline therapy
TB of the spine
Sickle cell disease
Radiation therapy
Repeated renal biopsies.

questions.question: In the RIFLE Classification, Acute Renal failure is defined as:

options.option: Reduction in urine output to less than 50mls/min
Reduction of GFR to less than 50mls/min.
Sudden reduction in corticomedullary ratio to less than 1/3 of that in health.
Elevation of blood urea nitrogen accompanied by vomiting and flapping tremor
Reduction in urine output to less than 0.3mls/kg /hr for 24 hours.

questions.question: The following are notable features of Alports’ Syndrome

options.option: Proteinuria with microscopic hematuria
Sensorineural deafness
Progressive glomerular disease
Frequent subclinical episodes of pulmonary embolism
Large palpable kidneys.

questions.question: The following are true in End Stage Renal failure:

options.option: A renal biopsy is vital in making the diagnosis
Renal transplantation is not recommended for diabetic patients
Diabetes Mellitus could develop for the first time after renal transplantation.
Anaemia treatment is unnecessary in the minority of patients on regular 3 times a week dialysis.
Peritoneal dialysis allows a more liberal dietary prescription than hemodialysis.

questions.question: The following are classical of trypanosomiasis:

options.option: The disease is conveyed by bites of infected female tsetse flies only
The Gambiense infection runs an abrupt course terminating in death within months, whereas the Rhodesiense infection is more insidious F (swapped)
Painless cervical lympladenopathy and fever are commonly features
A lumbar puncture is useful in diagnosis
Treatment with Pentamidine is beneficial when there is evidence in CNS infection.F(Ornithine)

questions.question: Concerning Amoebicdysentery:

options.option: The aetiologic agent is Entamoeba histrolytical which is a unicellular parasite. T
Clinical manifestations are usually restricted to the abdomen.F(Skin – genital ulcer)
The finding of the encysted organism in a stool specimen always indicates a carrier state.
Diagnostic tools include antibody immunoflourescence tests.
Treatment of choice is use of oral metronidozole

questions.question: In Cholera infection:

options.option: The organism secretes a powerful exotoxin which is responsible for massive loss of intestinal fluid
Acute renal failure does not constitute a factor for poor outcome of treatment
The diagnosis is made only bacteriologically.
Treatment is primarily by use of antiemetic and antidiarrhoeal drugs
There is no need for notification.

questions.question: In Severe Malaria Infection:

options.option: Severe anaemia is usually due to drug reactions.
Renal failure is due to Malarial Nephropathy.
A thick blood film is useful in determining the developmental stage of the parasite.
Immunochromatographic dipsticks tests for malaria are available therefore blood film examinations are unnecessary
Due to drug resistance, Quinine remains a first drug of choice in its treatment.

questions.question: In typhoid fever:

options.option: The fever is usually intermittent and prolonged
A blood culture in the 4th week of infection is usually more superior to that of stool or urine.
The presence of a leukocytosis usually rules out the diagnosis
In the carrier state a cholecystectomy

questions.question: Concerning the following:

options.option: The presence of leucocytosis in a patient with DKA confirms the presence of infection
Diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) does not occur in persons with Type 2 diabetes
The initial fluid of choice in the rehydration of patients with DKA is isotonic saline (0.9% NaCl)
NPH insulin is a good choice for the management of patients presenting with acute metabolic complications of diabetes mellitus
Heavy alcohol ingestion increases the risk of developing severe hypoglycemia in a person with diabetes mellitus
